website_summaries.verdict: A mounted design makes this a sturdy choice that's great for workshops.
pros: As long as you don't need a portable stand, this affordable mounted rack is well built and versatile
If space is a factor, this is the best option because it takes up a fraction of the room as most bike stands
The clamp fits tubes from 1.18" to 2.95"
cons: The arm keeps bikes fairly close to the workbench, which could present challenges while doing repairs

customer_reviews.title: Great concept with design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept I like the fact that I can have this on my workbench how ever plastic parts are cheap and don’t hold anything. This doesn’t stay in place when you have a bike on it so for that I will give it four stars
customer_reviews.author: firerunner

customer_reviews.title: Works great with our vintage -- and quite heavy-- mountain bikes
customer_reviews.text: Works great with our vintage -- and quite heavy-- mountain bikes. Seems to be plenty strong, a really amazing buy for the price. Note that it mounts on a horizontal surface, like the top of your workbench. I drilled four mounting holes all the way through my bench back about an inch from the forward edge, wing nuts on threaded bolts let me pop the whole thing on and off in a jiffy. Make sure the bike bike hangs out far enough so the pedals can be spun without hitting the bench. The front wheel will rest on the floor. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: meadowreader

customer_reviews.title: It is just okay.
customer_reviews.text: It is okay for some things, but if you have a dual suspension bike, the only way to use this is to clamp the seat post. the arm that clamps the seat post doesn't tighten enough to hold the bike in a position for maintenance. Also, it does not extend far enough to allow the pedals to turn (like when cleaning'/lubing the chain). But it is much better than nothing at all. I would think that a free standing repair stand is going to be in my future.
customer_reviews.author: The Gekko  Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but is not very robust
customer_reviews.text: it does the job, but is not very robust. The plastic jaw protectors fall off all the time. I wrapped the entire jaw area with duct tape - looks like crap but keeps everything together. The cross bar is not very long. Also, the "T" connector and entire clamp assembly is plastic. It barely holds my mountain bike. We will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: hogner

customer_reviews.title: ... which is mostly cleaning of the bike it is great. I worry about the plastic where the arm ...
customer_reviews.text: For what I do which is mostly cleaning of the bike it is great. I worry about the plastic where the arm intersects that if you were to do some heavy work on the bike like tighting bolts and such that might be a weak point. Other than that it works great for me and the price was great. I think if I had lots of bikes to work on I would start looking for something more heavy duty. My use is more cleaning and small adjustments. If that one piece were more metal or heavier material would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I mounted it to an old work bench and have used it for a DIY MTB upgrade project! Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The quick release is nice, but it is difficult to get a strong ...
customer_reviews.text: The quick release is nice, but it is difficult to get a strong grip on the bike to keep it from moving around when you tilt, for example. I would have liked the extending arm to be longer to get the bike further away from the bench. But it works well, is inexpensive and mostly unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Makes it very easy to work on bike
customer_reviews.text: I had made something similar but not as sturdy. For $30 this is better, more durable. I set it up to quickly mount to a Rockwell JawStand XP and the combination works well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this unit
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this unit. Of course it it not as robust as a $150 one from Park but it works well for me. When you clamp it to your bike it is good to find a point that will have the bike somewhat in balance. In the case of one of my mountain bikes, I have to clamp to the downtube and it wants to twist the horizontal bar of the repair mount. In that case I just have to tighten down quite a bit on the knob on the T connector to keep it from twisting. This works well for me and a good tool for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Duncan

customer_reviews.title: surprised in a good way
customer_reviews.text: better product than I was expecting Yes its metal pipe with plastic components but still heavy duty for what it does. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette Wehman

customer_reviews.title: OK but slips too much
customer_reviews.text: Bikes tend to rotate too easily. You have to keep it balanced or it will rotate until it is, at which point the front wheel may end up directly over the rear one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and sturdy yet relatively inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive yet sturdy and effective bike frame holder. Assembly of my bike after a repainting project became easy. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ray J

customer_reviews.title: Good value , cheaper than others
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the money .mounted to my workbenche used it a few times while doing work on my bicycles
customer_reviews.author: Rob Mcnew

customer_reviews.title: No more struggling with bike repairs and didn’t break the bank!
customer_reviews.text: What a treat! After years of struggling without a stand for bike repairs this was an inexpensive solution that worked perfectly!! I was concerned that it wasn’t going to be sturdy because it was way cheaper than some others, but we were extremely satisfied with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: becky ziminsky

customer_reviews.title: I really like this for working on my bike
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for working on my bike. It's easy to set up and is durable. My only gripe is that the rotation knob doesn't grip hard enough to hold the bike in a position that isn't balanced. If I clamp it at the seatpost the bike angles front down and it will not hold it in a level position. Not a huge deal, but it keeps me from giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for home use bike repair stand.
customer_reviews.text: The metal portion seems well built and sturdy but the plastic parts concern me. I am using this for my own bikes and it will not be used everyday and that is probably fine. The professional and more substantial bike repair stands cost several times what this unit does so for the price and for light home use this unit will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Slow order but good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd such vise I use for my bicycles. One is at home and the other is400 miles west at the cabin. For the price, it is very good and does what I want. I'm an avid cycling hobbiest (if there is such a thing) and I needed a good stable vise for routine maitenance at each location.
customer_reviews.author: gayle nelson

customer_reviews.title: Both my MTB are under 29 pounds and this is a great investment. The only thing it will do if ...
customer_reviews.text: I mounted it to a shed post and put the clamp on the bar coming straight out to avoid too much stress. Both my MTB are under 29 pounds and this is a great investment. The only thing it will do if you mount it the way it comes is the clamps are plastic and have a hard time holding the bike if there is too much torque.
customer_reviews.author: 4x4

customer_reviews.title: Modified for specific use
customer_reviews.text: I took the T junction off the base and it fits perfectly over a PA speaker tripod to make a free standing work stand. I have an aluminum road bike and it works, but the head is not as sturdy as I would like. I don't know if this would be a good solution for a mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I do find that it slips a little bit if the bike's weight is not centered... But for the money... Well priced and does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Stuck it on my workbench, and it makes working ...
customer_reviews.text: Stuck it on my workbench, and it makes working on the bike a lot easier. It's obviously made for a bike with a round cross-section on the top bar, which mine doesn't quite have, but there's enough pinch to keep it tight for most basic work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and stores nicely.
customer_reviews.text: Wow - what a great deal! I used to have an expensive Park stand that used up too much space in my garage. This one mounts on a workbench out of the way and I can turn it around backwards to store it. It has all the adjustments of my Park stand, but is more compact and out of the way. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t hold the bike, clamp parts fall off. Had to drill through the tube and bolt it to get it to hold a bike on the extension arm. Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Mortenson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Been using regularly for a year. Holding up well. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: You can not find a better bench stand for the money. I use it for my Carbon Trek Domane 4.5 and it works great. I'm not sure I would recommend this product for a heavier commuter bike. I have been using this repair stand for over a year now and everything holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Regretful buy
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a so so deal at first but after a year of light use it's just worn out and worthless. I regret buying it. Just too cheap and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Guess I could've guess what I was going to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Guess I could've guess what I was going to get with the price... Decent stand that holds bikes up to 30-40lbs without too much trouble. The plastic fittings can slip sometimes and seem a little cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product especially for the price, had to modify the orange rubber grips so that I could operate the rear brake and derailer while in the stand but easy to do with a razor knife as the rubber is soft. My cable run beneath the top bar and although there is a gap to allow cable to run, it wasn;t wide enough in my case.
customer_reviews.author: BondFam

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand!!
customer_reviews.text: For repairing and adjusting my bikes this is a great stand. Easy to operate and very well contructed. I would highly recommend it to a friend!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: works great for the money
customer_reviews.text: works great for the money. weight of bike tends to cause mount to pivot in holder. i wouldn't buy it if i had to use it in a bike shop, but for home repairs it sure beats turning the bikes upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: joint section is a tiny bit loosed. but it works. i bought it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jLo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to attach to my work bench. The clamp on this stands works just as well as more expensive Bike service stands while saving space and looking good too!
customer_reviews.author: Zack S.

customer_reviews.title: Great but ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good , only problem is the knob that keeps the clamp from turning is not strong enough to hd my bike , other than that I'm liking this clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The join clamps could be a bit more supportive. ...
customer_reviews.text: The join clamps could be a bit more supportive. It does hold my bike, but it can spin in the clamp portion (think rock side to side (front wheel to back wheel)).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand!
customer_reviews.text: Really great repair stand for the $$$. It’s as sturdy as the workbench you mount it to. Plus you can flip it around when you’re not using it so it doesn’t stick out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nance

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level bike repair stand
customer_reviews.text: Not bad but not good either. It's hardware feels cheap and the clamp is weak. That being said I don't do a ton of work on my bike so it works good for me. If you plan on using it a lot I suggest getting a park tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schutte

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a cheap withstand
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for a cheap withstand. Can't get the clamp tight enough to stop some movement with the full suspension bikes but works great with our handrails.
customer_reviews.author: robert patterson

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold a heavy bicycle upright or horizontal!
customer_reviews.text: The rotating locking device will not hold a 25 or more pound bicycle, but does work well with my light weight road bike. The clamp should have been made of metal material!
customer_reviews.author: David Lopez

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you maintain your own bike.
customer_reviews.text: This bench stand is a lifesaver! The price is fine and the quality is good. I use it to work on my family's bikes and I think it will out last the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Countryman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Needs set screws so the plastic doesnt slip on the metal
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Good value. If you want a bike stand buy one but this is nice for one sided bench work.
customer_reviews.author: Erik D.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, but get's the job done. Just take it easy on this one.
customer_reviews.author: jazzharp

customer_reviews.title: Good mount for price
customer_reviews.text: Good stand for price. Be sure to mount on stiff surface. Slight rotational slipping when attached to seat post.
customer_reviews.author: mcp70

customer_reviews.title: Black and orange really looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction!! I use mine for fork tube tear downs on Harley Davidsons. Black and orange really looks good.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Colquitt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. I mounted my holder on my little bench, hold well for a folding bike, never tried a full size bike as I do not own one. 4 stars for me
customer_reviews.author: LAWRENCE K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Helpful. For what I do, it works. If you are looking for professional grade - you will have to pay the money.
customer_reviews.author: bfsb

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain
customer_reviews.text: Simple, well thought out and relatively sturdy. Very low price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Twodogs

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Ever Do Without This?
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, simple design makes servicing a bicycle a breeze! Should have bought one years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It has worked better than what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It has worked better than what I expected. I installed on my work table and I can rotated to get out of my way when I don't use it. It holds a hevy bike very well too.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Viramontes

customer_reviews.title: Great value and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Price is right, plenty sturdy for my road bike. No bolts or instructions.
customer_reviews.author: MM007

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent set it on my workbench in minutes tuned my bike and off i went. ppc
customer_reviews.author: su fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Decent stand for home use. Not super strong but great for tire changes and tune ups
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: The third hand I always needed !
customer_reviews.text: Great product , it is so much easier to work on you bike when is safe and secure .
customer_reviews.author: Steve Christiano

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well made for the price
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes of occasional bike work on my personal bike, I was impressed at the quality/price ratio and it sure beat the cobbled-up setup I had previously on my workbench to hold the bike up for service. I was a little leary about how hard I had to crank down on the knobs to get it to keep from twisting or tilting at times, but it held up and was solid. It made working on crankset, freewheel, brakes etc. a breeze. Definitely recommended for the casual rider, it's solid and very well made for the price.
customer_reviews.author: icheckemout

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: always wanted one to work on my bike, this works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: dale rider

customer_reviews.title: Bolted to work bench nicely. Beats paying $200 for a floor stand
customer_reviews.text: Bolted to work bench nicely. Beats paying $200 for a floor stand. Rear clamp has a tendency to slip if bike is not balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Marx

customer_reviews.title: Solid mount, slippy joints
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 4 star, except for the price point compared to the Park Tool offerings. I used bolts with wing nuts to bolt to my bench to make it kinda quick release. I can't hold my aluminum Fuji on the vertical post, as the joint between the horizontal and vertical joints doesn't hold that great. So, I just use the horizontal pipe and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich J.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price. You get what you pay ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price. You get what you pay for. Too much reliance on plastic pieces which get worn out quickly
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kyle Benton

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for I guess. This bike stand is very poor quality and it broke upon my first use. I was able to fix it with some ingenuity and a hose clamp from ACE hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Mikael Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This stand was almost perfect the only reason its not 5 stars is the ...
customer_reviews.text: This stand was almost perfect the only reason its not 5 stars is the 90 degree angle joint isnt as beefy as i would like, i can tell you that with a heavy frame and larger tires you might snap the plastic if your pipe arm is fully extended. I will be taping and possibly using zip ties to ensure it wont break. If they create a 90 degree piece with aluminum and sell it, i will buy it, then change my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: The best bike repair stand for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This stand is really well made for the price. My only complaint is there are no fasteners to install the stand to a table. So no screws or anything, but for the price I can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie C. Michael IV

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. However, the frame clamp is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. However, the frame clamp is lightly oversized for normal bicycle tubes so one there is some weight - front or rear - it tends to swivel that way.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This work stand is okay if you have the money I insist you get a park
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Vallez

customer_reviews.title: Plastic clamps😕
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is plastic and looks like it will not hold up when tightened. Weight of bike turns the tube. If the hardware was metal I would probably rate 5 stars. Does the job for the price and for occasional users.
customer_reviews.author: osprey

customer_reviews.title: HALF OF BIKESTAND??!
customer_reviews.text: I got this item or should I say HALF ITEM in the mail, I did recive the mount peice shown in the description, but not the clamp peice or the arm extending straight out. Very dissapointed that someone could actually forget half an item...
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Finkel

product_meta.title: Conquer Bench Mount Bike Repair Stand Bicycle Rack
feature_bullets: Rotating head adjusts clamp to any angle
Clamp allows for clamping of tubes from 30mm to 75mm
Durable steel construction, mounting flange has 4 holes (hardware not included)
Easily attached to virtually and bench, arm extends 10 in. from bench

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
